title: Lindsay Lohan 'won't return for Masked Singer Australia season 2'
text:
Lindsay Lohan is reportedly stepping down from The Masked Singer Australia (Picture: Ten)

Lindsay Lohan is being axed from The Masked Singer Australia after becoming ‘tricky with demands’, according to new reports.

The actress has been appearing on the loved show – where viewers have to guess which famous faces are showing off their singing talent behind elaborate costumes – for the past season.

Lindsay appears on the show alongside Dannii Minogue, Dave Hughes and Jackie O, competing against each other as they try and figure out who’s behind the masks thanks to subtle hints.

However, while the format has proven to be a hit with Australian audiences, unfortunately behind-the-scenes sources are reporting that they’re looking to let Lindsay go.

‘She was tricky with demands and had a complete lack of respect for time schedules,’ sources told New Idea.

Metro.co.uk has contacted Lindsay’s reps for comment.

Lindsay is reportedly not returning for The Masked Singer Australia season 2 (Picture: Ten)

While the report claims Lindsay’s on the out, it appears she’s made a tight bond with co-star Dannii, who revealed that they connected thanks to their history as child stars.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I said to her, “I want you to know that I read that you started when you were five and I started at seven. Not many other people will have done that or know what you’ve been through,” ‘ Dannii explained to Daily Telegraph.

‘I just wanted her to know, “Hey, I totally get it and I’m not going to judge what’s out there because I wouldn’t want people to do that to me either”.

Lindsay has since called Dannii her big sister as she adjusted to life in Australia filming the series.

The Masked Singer Australia airs on Network Ten in Australia and is yet to get a UK release date.

description: Actress Lindsay Lohan was reportedly 'tricky with demands' for Masked Singer Australia and so has been ditched for future series
